contenido.en:
Many religions practice infant baptism to initiate children into the faith. However, Jehovahâ€™s Witnesses believe baptism should take place only after the person gains Bible knowledge and consciously decides to dedicate their life to God.

ğŸ”¹ Biblical baptism requires understanding and faith
> â€œWhen they believed... they were baptized, both men and women.â€ â€” Acts 8:12
> â€œRepent and be baptized, each one of you...â€ â€” Acts 2:38
Babies cannot believe, repent, or make spiritual decisions. Baptism is for informed individuals.

ğŸ”¹ Jesus was baptized as an adult example
> â€œAfter being baptized, Jesus came up from the water...â€ â€” Matthew 3:16-17

ğŸ”¹ Only those taught can be baptized
> â€œGo, therefore, and make disciples... baptizing them... teaching them to observe.â€ â€” Matthew 28:19-20

ğŸ”¹ Personal faith is a prerequisite
> â€œIf you believe with all your heart, you may.â€ â€” Acts 8:36-37 (footnote)

ğŸ”¹ Baptism is a public declaration of dedication

ğŸ”¹ Infant baptism was not practiced in the apostolic era

ğŸ”¹ Forcing a child without consent opposes free will
